snippet: As long as the Republican of the Hour was standing on a podium, the Republican Party of California was standing right behind him.     Everyone, after all, loves a winner. And Senator John McCain of Arizona was still glowing over his 19-point victo...
lead_paragraph: As long as the Republican of the Hour was standing on a podium, the Republican Party of California was standing right behind him. Everyone, after all, loves a winner. And Senator John McCain of Arizona was still glowing over his 19-point victory in the New Hampshire primary on Tuesday, not to mention the $1.8 million his campaign has raised over the Internet since then, as he gave the keynote address at the California Republican Party convention here this afternoon.
abstract: Sen John McCain attends California Republican Party convention in Burlingame, but Gov George W Bush skips it; Bush is still presidential candidate of choice for most of state's party faithful; photo (M)

headline.main: McCain Basks in the Applause, but the Whispered Party Line Favors Bush
